intro: Annona guaricensis, commonly known as the Guariçense custard apple, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and fragrant, white flowers. The plant produces a fruit with a thick, yellowish skin and a creamy, aromatic pulp. Its fruit is often used in local cuisines and traditional medicine. The plant thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests.
